name: Additional Emblem
description: Choose an additional Level 1 Emblem from the list. When you transform, you may choose which emblem to use (only one emblem is active at a time). While transformed, you may choose to switch emblems as an action.

name: Additional forms / transformations
description: “Fusion”

name: Chroma Ranger Initiate
description: Chroma Armor: When you transform, your armor takes on a single main hue. Choose a color below. You gain +5 armor against certain attack tags based on the color chosen. Red: Fire Blue: Water Green: Poison Black: Earth Pink: Wind Yellow: Electric White: Ice/Cold Fight as One: You gain a number of “Boosts” equal to your Primary Attribute. When you or an ally in your aura succeeds on an attack roll, you can spend 1 “Boost” to Mark one of the targets. All attacks against the marked target get a +1D Status bonus until the end of your next turn.

name: Giant of Light Initiate
description: Giant of Light Form: While in Hero Form, as an action you may choose to gain 1 strain and transform into a Giant of Light form. When you do, increment your power die. Your scale increases by 1, and you gain +1 armor (stacking with your Hero form’s armor). While in this form you gain +1 strain at the beginning of each of your turns. Once you activate this form, it cannot be activated again until you take a short rest.

name: Switching forms more easily
description: Improved vehicle (flying, underwater, transforming, space)? Extradimensional space (e.g. Triassic Ranger)

name: Calming Beam
description: “Ultra Armor” - immune to heat, electricity, etc

name: Scanning to identify enemy weaknesses
description: Henshin Hero Feats

name: Shrink / freeze enemies
description: “Judge the guilty” (S.P.D.)

name: Stealth Suit
description: “Clock-Up” - speed up, slowing time around

name: temporary / time-limited transformations (color timer)
description: “Ultra Beam”

name: Animal Transformation
description: When you activate your Guardian Transformation, or as an action while transformed, you can enter an animal form. You may choose any Scale 0 or 1 animal that does not have a fly speed or a swim speed. You maintain your mental and spiritual attributes, but your physical attributes match your new form. You retain access to your skills and Powers, but can only perform actions that your new form is capable of.

name: Celestial Knight Path Initiate
description: Celestial Armor: While transformed, your Guardian form gains a suit of magical armor. This armor grants you a +1D Equipment bonus to all defenses while adjacent to an enemy. Knight Combat Training: You do not suffer a penalty when making a ranged Spell attack while within 5 feet of an enemy. You gain Beginner Training and a Slow skill progression in either Targeting or Melee Weapons.

name: Dark Witch Path Initiate
description: Fallen Rose Necklace: While in Guardian Form, as an action you may choose to gain 1 strain and transform into a Witch form. When you do, increment your power die. Additional witch form benefits TBD. While in this form you gain +1 strain at the beginning of each of your turns. If you become overstrained while in this form, roll on the “Curse Table” below. The curse lasts until the end of combat. Once you activate this form, it cannot be activated again until you take a short rest. Design note: I might have to rearrange things a bit, but maybe while in Witch form, every time you successfully hit an enemy with an attack the *enemy* becomes cursed, and rolls on the curse table?

name: Dazzling Transformation
description: Your transformation sequence is so bright and sparkling that it has the potential to dazzle your enemies. When you transform, roll Spellcasting vs Spiritual Defense, affecting all hostile creatures within 4 squares. On a failed defense, those creatures are Off-Guard 1 , or Off-Guard 2 on a critical failure.

name: Merfolk Transformation
description: When you activate your Guardian Transformation, or as an action while transformed, you can activate a Merfolk form. In this form, your legs transform into a fish or dolphin-like tail, you gain the ability to breathe both air and water, and you can swim at a speed equal to your walking speed. Your movement on land is halved in this form, and you cannot jump.

name: Sacred Priestex Staff
description: Your Transformation Object begins to shine with Sacred Spiritual Energy. It has a special store of Energy (separate from your character’s energy) equal to your Spellcasting Attribute, and regains 1 Energy per round. This energy can only be spent on spells to heal an ally, or spells that target a Spirit.

name: Sparkling Idol Path Initiate
description: Sparkling Melody Instrument: This accessory can take the form of any musical instrument, including a microphone. You gain the Idol Inspiration Reaction. Idol Inspiration (1 Reaction): When an ally within 6 squares fails a skill roll, you can inspire them with a quick song. They roll a number of additional dice equal to your Spellcasting Rank. Design note: Work-in-progress

name: Spell Sniper
description: Double the range of all of your attack spells that have a range of at least 2 squares. Enemies do not gain a defense bonus due to being obscured against your spells.

name: Bolstering Aegis
description: Bolstering Aegis (1 Action or Reaction + 3 Energy, Sustained). 1 Target, Range 6 Reaction Trigger: When a creature within range is targeted by an attack. You infuse the target with magical energy, bolstering their defensive abilities. The target gains a +1D status bonus to all defenses for the duration of the effect

name: Counter spell / dispel / spirit energy disruption
description: Group teleport?

name: Guardian Bubble (1 Action or Reaction). 1 Target, Range 6
description: Reaction Trigger: When a creature within range is hit by an attack You surround a creature with a Bubble of protective energy that absorbs damage. This bubble can appear to be made of soap film, glowing energy, hard candy coating, or any number of other materials. The creature gains wards based on your Spellcasting Skill rank and the energy spent. Rank 1:  5 wards, +1 ward per energy Rank 2:  8 wards, +1 ward per energy Rank 3:  11 wards, +1 ward per energy Rank 4:  14 wards, +1 wards per energy Rank 5:  17 wards, +2 wards per energy Rank 6:  20 wards, +2 wards per energy Bond Effect: Grant an additional +1 ward for each bond rank with the target

name: Guardian Feat
description: You learn a single Magical Guardian class feat, or a general feat.

name: Improved healing
description: “Drain Life” - heal a bit when you do damage

name: Instant Transformation
description: When you roll initiative you can automatically transform into your Magical Guardian form (no action required).

name: Memory manipulation
description: Summoning?

name: More “meta-magic” type feats
description: “Split Healing” (when you heal one person, heal another a little also)

name: On a success, the target is stunned 2 (defense roll ends)
description: On a critical success, the target falls unconscious.

name: Prismatic Burst
description: Prismatic Burst: (1 Action + 5 Energy): Primary (Spellcasting) vs Spiritual Defense. Range 8, affects a 2 by 2 square area. All creatures in the area take 5 + Hits damage.

name: Size changing
description: Improved Familiar?

name: Small divination
description: Small conjuration? Reducing Strain?

name: Some kind of armor (spiritual?)
description: Cast spells through armor / weapon attacks and spells at the same time (ranged weapons increase spell range?)

name: Stop time
description: Reverse time / time travel

name: Master Spellcasting
description: Your training in the Spellcasting Skill increases to Rank 3 (Master). Magical Guardian Feats

name: Super Guardian Transformation
description: In dire situations, your Magical Guardian unlocks the ability to ascend to a more powerful form. If your guardian is already transformed, they may spend an additional action and X energy to transform into their “Super” form. In this form gain TBD

name: Access to vehicles
description: “Class Archetype” Initiate feats

name: Amorphous
description: Gelatinous or shape-changing creatures. Slimes, blobs, liquid-based creatures. Fluid Form: Can squeeze through gaps at least 1 inch wide, and can adjust shape to fit any container with the same scale or higher.

name: Amphibious Form
description: Your shape changes to be more suited to navigating the water - your hands and feet become webbed, you sprout gills, and you may gain other traits of aquatic / semi-aquatic creatures. While in this form you can breathe both air and water, and can swim at your normal movement speed.

name: Aquatic
description: Water-based creatures, built for swimming. Fish, amphibians, sea monsters. Water Adaptation: Can breathe underwater and move at full speed while swimming

name: Archetypes
description: An archetype is your familiar’s basic role in the game. Are they a strong, tanky creature that can take a few hits? Or more of an intelligent “partner in crime”, who would rather avoid a battlefield? The archetype determines the familiar’s starting ability scores, grants a unique feature, and determines the statistics for their basic attack. The final attack name is formed by combining modifiers from the corresponding columns in the “Archetype” and “Template” tables

name: Armored
description: Pilots and other occupants gain full cover while inside the vehicle

name: Artifact
description: A powerful magical / technological item grants the heroes their powers. This item is very explicitly NOT created by the character - instead, they were given, chosen by, or simply found the item. The item has a long and mysterious history, which is unknown to the user at first. The artifact can take many forms, but is always at least semi-sentient, and has a will of its own. It has chosen its wielder for a purpose, but they must discover what that purpose is.

name: Attack Modifiers
description: Attacks with the fire tag inflict “Burning 1” on a success, and “Burning 2” on a critical success. Defense rolls against abilities with the Fire tag inflict “Burning 1” on a success, and “Burning 2” on a critical success.

name: Attack Modifiers
description: If a creature fails in a defense against an attack or ability with the “Water” trait, they gain the “Soaked” condition.

name: Attack Modifiers
description: Earth attacks channel the power of rock and stone to deal heavy, crushing blows. These attacks deal additional damage based on the Earth Rank, and knock enemies prone on a critical hit.

name: Attack Modifiers
description: Melee attacks infused with Wind can push enemies a number of squares equal to the Rank of the Wind. Ranged attacks have their ranges increased by an amount equal to the Rank of the Wind.

name: Avian
description: Winged or bird-like creatures, favoring speed. Birds, griffons, harpies, winged reptiles. Gliding Movement: This creature does not take damage from falling (as long as they are not restrained). This creature can expend their movement to move horizontally while falling (up to 1 square of movement per square of falling).

name: Basic Elements
description: Each element is unique, and interacts with the environment in different ways. While they may all share the same list of Elemental Features, the features behave differently depending on which element is being used.

name: Beast
description: Standard animal-like creature, quadrupedal or bipedal. Wolves, tigers, rodents, dogs, felines. Keen Smell: This creature has an enhanced sense of smell with a range of 12 squares. The creature knows the location of hidden or invisible creatures within this range. As long as the creature is not behind an obstruction, it is considered “obscured” to this creature, rather than “hidden”.

name: Bond of Patronage
description: You gain a level 1 Bond with your Patron. Your Patron has certain expectations of you. If you fail to live up to your side of the bargain, the bond can be “Broken”. If this happens, your Patron can choose to restrict access to your powers, or even temporarily prevent you from accessing them entirely.

name: Bond of Patronage
description: You gain a level 1 Bond with your Patron. Your Patron has certain expectations of you. If you fail to live up to your side of the bargain, the bond can be “Broken”. If this happens, your Patron can choose to restrict access to your powers, or even temporarily prevent you from accessing them entirely.

name: Bonded Relic
description: The artifact is not just an object - it has a will of its own, and a unique relationship with its wielder. You gain a Rank 2 bond with the Artifact. This relationship is a two-way street - the Artifact grants you power, but also expects something of you in return. Determine what the Artifact’s goal is, and summarize it in a short statement - a sentence or two. Whenever you perform an action that helps the Artifact further its goal, increment your Power Die.

name: Bug
description: Arthropod-based creatures with adaptable bodies. Beetles, ants, mantises, spiders. Exoskeleton: Gain 1 armor, but reduce movement speed by 1

name: Camouflage
description: Your skin adapts to blend in with your environment. You gain a +1 Status Bonus to Stealth checks.

name: Car
description: Size: 3 x 2 squares (Scale 2) Strength: 5 Agility: 5 Speed: 10 HP: 20 Armor: 1 Tags: Enclosed Upgrade Slots: 3 Occupants: 3

name: Controlling a Vehicle
description: The vehicle does not have its own actions - any actions taken by the vehicle require the Pilot or an Occupant to spend an action. Most vehicles also do not have their own energy, and any energy requirements must be paid by the Pilot or an Occupant. While controlling the vehicle you can perform any actions that the vehicle has, as long as your Driving Rank is high enough to operate the vehicle. While inside a vehicle your character loses the ability to perform most skills and abilities. For example, you cannot perform a Martial Arts Combo against an enemy while driving a car. Players may propose actions that they wish to perform while operating a vehicle, but it is ultimately up to the GM to determine which actions can be taken.

name: Curse
description: Your powers are granted by a curse, hex, or other malicious magic. Although your powers seem like a gift, they come with a cost. 1. Who cursed you? Why? What do they want? 2. Curse should be tied to a character’s past - something they did caused them to be cursed. What is it? 3. How can the curse be broken? Does your character want to break it? 4. What is the cost of the curse? Is the cost something that has already happened, or something that will happen? 5. Is there a drawback to using the powers that the curse grants you? Curse is tied to a vice - using the powers could corrupt the character making them more likely to fall to the temptation of their vice? Examples: Inuyasha, Nezuko (Demon Slayer), Guts (Berserk)

name: Defense Modifiers
description: Squares and objects that are burning can “obscure” a creature on the other side. If a creature is protected by a shield, armor, wall, or aura of flame, all affected squares are treated as if they are burning (but the creature that created the effect is unaffected). This means that if a creature enters a Fire aura, or attacks a creature with a Fire shield, they must make a Physical Defense roll against the fire (as if they had started their turn in a burning square).

name: Defense Modifiers
description: Melee attacks made while either the attacker or target are in water take a -1D Circumstance penalty (unless the attacking creature has a Swim Speed). Ranged attacks that pass through squares containing water have their ranges halved. Creatures that are behind at least 1 square of water are  “Obscured”.

name: Defense Modifiers
description: Defensively, Earth can block line of sight (granting cover), as well as adding additional armor (damage reduction). The amount of armor depends on the Earth Rank. Defensive Earth abilities also grant resistance to Forced Movement. Cover, armor, shields, etc. made from Earth have HP, and can be destroyed by dealing enough damage to them.

name: Defense Modifiers
description: Attacks that pass through an area of wind take a penalty equal to ½ the Rank of the Wind (rounded down, min 1). If these attacks critically fail, the controller of the wind can redirect the attack to target a different creature within range. That creature defends as if they were the original target of the attack. Defensive abilities (such as shields and armor) can also be used to protect the user against falling and forced movement by counteracting it with the force of the Wind.

name: Defensive Evolution
description: Your mutation also helps protect you from external threats. When you take damage, you may spend 2 energy to adapt to that attack. If you do, choose 1 of that attack’s “tags” - you gain Armor (e.g. reduce damage) from attacks with the chosen tag equal to your Strength. For example, if you have Strength 3 and are hit with a fire-based attack, you can gain heat-resistant skin that grants Armor 3 to subsequent “fire” attacks. Lasts until the end of this combat. Once per round when you reduce damage due to Armor, you may increment your Power Die.

name: Defensive power - Ward around self or allies
description: Emotion abilities affect multiple nearby targets? Examples: Power Rangers + Zordon, Cardcaptor Sakura (Cerberus), Deku + All Might (My Hero Academia)

name: Defensive power - Ward around self or allies
description: Emotion abilities affect multiple nearby targets? Examples: Power Rangers + Zordon, Cardcaptor Sakura (Cerberus), Deku + All Might (My Hero Academia)

name: Demon of Hard Work
description: Your powers are not biological, mechanical, magical, or spiritual. You simply learned to enhance your own body, and harness the energy that surrounds you, through sheer hard work. 1. Training is important - downtime requirement? 2. What is your motivation - why do you work so hard? 3. Ultimate Move - Limiter Removal - You always hold yourself back in some way - whether that be carrying around extra weight, wearing physical restraints, or a device that limits your energy consumption. Using your full potential puts a huge strain on your body, but you can do it for short periods of time. Examples: Saitama (One Punch Man), Rock Lee (Naruto), Krillin (Dragon Ball)

name: Earth
description: Earth is the element of stability and protection.

name: Elemental Features
description: When a character is using an Elemental Feature, they choose one (or sometimes more) of the elements that they control to modify the effect.

name: Elements
description: The current list of elements includes Fire, Water, Earth, and Wind. Each of these elements has an associated “tag”, and abilities that manipulate these elements can affect anything with the associated tag. That includes enemies, abilities, and environmental features. Elemental abilities also affect anything in the fiction that is associated with or made out of the element, even if it doesn’t explicitly have the tag. The DM has final say over what can be affected by these abilities.

name: Elite military training - improvements to flanking, teamwork
description: “War Cry” ability?

name: Empowering Tech
description: Once per round, when you make a Skill roll with an equipment bonus, you may increment your Power Die.

name: Enclosed
description: Pilots and other occupants gain partial cover while inside the vehicle

name: Entering / Exiting a Vehicle
description: It takes an action to get in or out of a vehicle.

name: Environmental Effects of Fire
description: A creature that enters a square that is burning, starts its turn there, or makes a melee attack against a target that is burning or in a square that is burning, must make a basic physical defense roll, taking 5 damage on a failure. On a failure, the creature also gains the Burning 1 condition (or Burning 2 on a critical failure). If the creature is already burning, increase the rank of the condition by 1 (e.g. a creature that is currently Burning 2 becomes Burning 3).

name: Environmental Interactions
description: Squares that are filled with water are considered Difficult Terrain for creatures that do not have a Swim Speed. Creatures and objects that enter or start their turn in a square filled with water gain the “Soaked” condition. Creatures that are fully engulfed in water (and cannot breath underwater) must hold their breath. Suffocation rules are TBD.

name: Environmental Interactions
description: Objects and terrain made from Earth are more stable than creations from other elements. A wall made of fire, water, or wind will disappear shortly after an element user stops concentrating on it. A wall made of stone, on the other hand, will remain standing with no additional input. These objects are opaque and solid, and can support the weight of a creature of the same or lesser scale. Earth objects and terrain can be destroyed by taking damage. A 1 square cube of earth at Rank 1 has 10 HP and 2 Armor. Higher ranks will increase the armor and HP.

name: Environmental Interactions
description: Wind terrain creates areas of strong wind that can push creatures around. When creatures enter an area of Wind terrain for the first time, or start their turn there, they are pushed by the wind. When the terrain is created, the direction of the wind is determined (North, South, East, West, Up, or Down). The wind will continue blowing in that direction until the effect is ended or the direction is intentionally changed by the user. The user can choose to change the direction when they sustain the effect.

name: Experiment
description: Your powers are man-made - granted by a scientific or government experiment in which you were an unwilling participant. These powers were triggered by dangerous chemical, biological, or spiritual manipulations, and many of the experimental subjects didn’t survive. You are one of the rare successes, and the organization that performed the experiments will do anything to learn how to repeat the outcome.

name: Exploratory Adaptations
description: Your mutations can be triggered by environmental factors, granting you a number of beneficial adaptations. You can activate these adaptations by spending 1 action and 2 energy. You may only have one adaptation active at a time.

name: Eyes of Legend
description: One of your bloodline’s most foundational techniques is the ability to channel spiritual energy into their eyes. On your turn, you may spend 1 Energy to activate your eye technique, allowing you to see invisible creatures by sensing their spiritual energy. You can also see other traces of concentrated spiritual energy, such as infused objects or the remnants of recent spiritual activity. Activating this ability triggers an obvious physical change in your eyes’ appearance. They may begin to glow, change color, your pupil might change shape, or some other obvious physical transformation.

name: Familiars
description: A Familiar, also called a Monster Companion, is a unique creature that has formed a strong bond with an individual. These creatures may have started out as a normal animal, an object, a virtual pet, or even an imaginary friend. Whatever the familiar’s original form, it was able to form a strong bond with a character. This bond allowed the character to subconsciously share their spirit energy, which transformed the monster into a unique companion. Due to their strong bond with a character, a familiar shares the character’s initiate, action points, and energy pool. All other stats (including attributes, HP, and skills) are separate.

name: Fire
description: Fire is an element of destruction. Its mechanics primarily focus on increasing damage by inflicting the “Burning” condition, and controlling the environment by igniting flammable objects. While it can be a potent destructive force, fire also comes with risks - fire is often uncontrollable, and allies (or even the user themselves) can easily be caught in the flames.

name: Flexible Gadgets
description: You have invented a number of additional utility gadgets equal to your Intellect. You can carry as many of these inventions with you as you wish, but each one takes up a spot in your inventory, and you may only activate one gadget at a time. While activated, each gadget grants a +1D equipment bonus to a single Utility Skill that you have at least Rank 1 training in. You may switch your activated gadget with another in your inventory as an action.

name: Font of Power
description: The entity’s spiritual energy is enormous, and can be drawn upon to enhance your own abilities. However, calling upon such power is not without cost. At any time, you may choose to take 1 Strain and gain a number of energy equal to your Willpower. Once per round, when you take Strain, you may increment your Power Die.

name: Friends in High Places
description: When making a skill check for resources or connections, your Patron may “Assist” you with the roll.

name: Friends in High Places
description: When making a skill check for resources or connections, your Patron may “Assist” you with the roll.

name: Fully transforming into the entity’s true form
description: A “combined form”, that grants full control and access to the entity’s powers Examples: Naruto Uzumaki (9 tailed spirit), Yuji Itadori (Jujutsu Kaisen), Parasyte, Chainsaw Man

name: Gaining wings to fly
description: Gaseous form - turn into an incorporeal cloud? Form made of light? More forms known?

name: Getaba Warrior
description: You are a member of the Getaba Species - a society that is built on a foundation of military prowess. Getaba warriors are some of the most powerful, disciplined warriors in the galaxy. Most of the time they appear mostly humanoid, but with some features that make them somewhat resemble a predatory animal - sharp teeth, slitted pupils, sometimes sharp pointed ears, and a tail. Getaba come in several varieties - some have features resembling Earth Wolves, while others are more akin to big cats such as Leopards or Tigers, or any number of other predatory beasts. When Getaba enter battle these features can become even more prominent, and some Getaba can even transform into a fully bestial form.

name: Hover
description: Vehicles with hover do not use extra movement for difficult terrain, and can move over both water and land.

name: Hover Board
description: Size: 1 x 1 squares (Scale 1) Strength: 2 Agility: 4 Speed: 8 HP: 10 Armor: 0 Tags: Hover Upgrade Slots: 1 Occupants: 0 Hop On: The Hover Board does not require an action to enter or exit the vehicle

name: HP
description: Phys. Def. Ment. Def. Spir. Def.

name: HP
description: Phys. Def. Ment. Def. Spir. Def.

name: HP
description: Phys. Def. Ment. Def. Spir. Def.

name: HP
description: Phys. Def. Ment. Def. Spir. Def.

name: HP
description: Phys. Def. Ment. Def. Spir. Def.

name: Hunter’s Instinct
description: A skilled hunter chooses their prey carefully. You may make an investigation action against a group of enemies, rather than an individual. Examples of questions include: Which enemy has the highest (or lowest) HP? Which enemy has the weakest physical (or mental, or spiritual) defense? Which enemy is the highest Threat Level? Which enemy is the most wounded? Which enemy has the highest Strength (or Agility)? As usual for Investigation Actions, you gain a +1D Circumstance bonus when acting upon this information

name: Ignition and Spread of Flames
description: Flammable objects in a square are ignited if they are targeted by an ability with the Fire tag, within the area of effect of an ability with the Fire tag, or if a creature with the Fire tag starts their turn in that square. At the start of each round, the fire spreads to adjacent squares (including vertically) if those squares are flammable. If an explosive object is ignited, it immediately explodes (the range and damage of this explosion depends on the ignited object).

name: Interaction with Other Elements
description: Water extinguishes fire of equal or lesser scale. Water can conduct lightning. Ice can freeze Water.

name: Interaction with Other Elements
description: Earth can smother flames of an equal or lower rank.

name: Interaction with Other Elements
description: Wind spreads fire. Wind can move or disperse gaseous effects in the environment (e.g. steam, smoke, poison gas).

name: Interactions with Other Elements
description: Water or Earth of equal or greater scale can put out a Fire. Wind can spread Fire. Fire can ignite Wood. Fire can melt Ice (turning it into Water).

name: Inventor
description: The character created machines / technology that manipulates energy for them, granting them special powers. This character does not actually have “Powers” per-se, but can mimic their effects with their technology.

name: Irresistible Authority
description: Your patron’s influence is powerful and widespread. With the mere mention of their name, other creatures become more willing to help (or fear) you. When you perform an action with the “Emotion” trait, you can spend a number of energy up to your Bond Rank with your Patron. Add a status bonus to the roll equal to the amount of energy spent. Your Patron’s authority over you also helps shield you from other, lesser influences. You can also gain this Status Bonus when making a defense check against an effect with the “Emotion” trait.

name: Irresistible Authority
description: Your patron’s influence is powerful and widespread. With the mere mention of their name, other creatures become more willing to help (or fear) you. When you perform an action with the “Emotion” trait, you can spend a number of energy up to your Bond Rank with your Patron. Add a status bonus to the roll equal to the amount of energy spent. Your Patron’s authority over you also helps shield you from other, lesser influences. You can also gain this Status Bonus when making a defense check against an effect with the “Emotion” trait.

name: Keen Senses
description: Your senses of hearing and smell are particularly sensitive. Using these powerful senses, you can detect the presence of hidden non-spirit creatures within 60 feet of you. You know their location, and they are only considered to be “obscured”, rather than “concealed”. In addition, if you know the scent of a particular creature or object, you can detect if they were in a particular location within the last hour, and if they are within 1000 feet you can detect which direction they are in.

name: Legend Reborn
description: You are a reincarnation of a hero from the past. You inherit their powers, and perhaps some of their memories, but are still learning how to access them. You were reincarnated in this time and place for a reason - there is an evil from your past that has risen again, and it is up to you to stop them once again. Example Characters - Aang / Korra (Avatar Universe), Yugi Muto (Pharaoh Atem), Sailor Moon (Queen Serenity), Link (Legend of Zelda)

name: Living Archive
description: The Artifact grants its wielder more than just power - it can share a wealth of knowledge as well . This knowledge may be innate, or it may have been accumulated over time from the collective knowledge of its past wielders. Either way, the Artifact can allow its wielder to occasionally tap into this knowledge. The Artifact starts out knowing 3 Skills. When its wielder makes a skill check using one of those known skills, they can spend 2 energy to allow the Artifact to “Assist” them on the action.

name: Lurking Threat
description: The entity inside you doesn’t enjoy being restrained, and is always looking for an opportunity to break free. When you drop to 0 HP or become Overstrained, the entity seizes the opportunity and temporarily possesses you, gaining control of your body and activating an “unleashed” transformation. During this transformation your appearance changes to more closely resemble the Entity’s true form. When you enter this form you regain all of your HP. While transformed, you must attempt to deal as much total damage to other creatures as possible, and make no distinction between allies and enemies. Any time you would deal damage to a creature, deal additional damage equal to your Willpower. This form ends when you drop to 0 HP again or combat ends.

name: Machine
description: Artificial or mechanical beings with unique construction. Golems, robots, drones. Mechanical Resilience: Immune to effects that require a biological body, such as poison or disease.

name: Magical Dimension
description: You have recently arrived in this world from another. In your homeworld, magical powers are commonplace - a far cry from the mundane, modern world you now find yourself in. Although you are no longer in your homeworld, you retain your supernatural abilities.

name: Making a Familiar
description: Choose the following: An “Archetype”, a creature “Template”, and 2 Level 1 Features.

name: Manifest Spirit
description: You cannot control your power directly - rather, it is controlled by your subconscious, and manifests as a separate entity. 1. Emotional link - because the power is subconscious, it is strongly affected by your emotions. Choose an emotion that strengthens the spirit, and a different emotion that weakens it. 2. Tethered Spirit - the spirit can move and use abilities on its own (still requiring your actions and energy to use). It gets weaker the further it strays from your location. Any damage the spirit takes is passed along to you. 3. What form does this spirit take? How does this reflect or react to your emotions? 4. How did your character first manifest this spirit? (Moment of extremely strong emotion) 5. Ultimate Move - Behind the Mask - The spirit undergoes a transformation, unlocking greater power. This is connected with a moment of clarity or emotional growth of the character Examples: Jotaro Kujo (Star Platinum), Joker (Arsene), Tokoyami (My Hero Academia)

name: More potent inventions (+2D equipment bonus)
description: Shared Inventions (Other characters may activate and equip gadgets) Power Bank - A limited battery of Spirit Energy that can be used to power abilities Microverse Backpack - inventions do not take up inventory space, stored in pocked dimension Portable workshop - Upgrade to Microverse Backpack - can carry an entire workshop in a pocket dimension Quick-Swap - Switching inventions once per turn does not require an action Examples - Tony Stark, Rintarou Okabe (Steins;Gate), Bulma (Dragon Ball), Syndrome (Incredibles)

name: Motorcycle
description: Size: 2 x 1 squares (Scale 2) Strength: 4 Agility: 8 Speed: 12 HP: 15 Armor: 0 Tags: Light Occupants: 1 Upgrade Slots: 2

name: Mutation
description: You are the next step in genetic evolution, and your powers are rooted in your unique biology. In addition to granting you your abilities, your mutation makes you more able to adapt to your environment and circumstances. In mere moments, you can adapt to situations that would normally take evolution millions of years to overcome. However, these abilities come at a cost - your physical adaptations clearly mark you as “other”, and can make it more challenging to fit in with society.

name: Occupants
description: Depending on the type of vehicle, there may be room for 1 or more Occupants (not including the Pilot). All occupants must be at least 1 scale lower than the vehicle. An occupant moves with the vehicle, but has no control over the vehicle’s movement. Depending on the vehicle’s features, an occupant may be able to perform other vehicle actions (for example, firing a mounted weapon).

name: Off-road
description: Off-road vehicles do not use extra movement for difficult terrain

name: Omnidirectional
description: The vehicle can move in any direction, and does not have a “facing” direction

name: Pickup Truck / Jeep
description: Size: 4 x 2 squares, 2 squares high (Scale 2) Strength: 6 Agility: 5 Speed: 9 HP: 25 Armor: 1 Tags: Enclosed, Off-road Upgrade Slots: 4 Occupants: 3

name: Pilot
description: Most vehicles require a Pilot (sometimes also called a Driver) to control it. The Pilot must be at least 1 Scale smaller than the vehicle, and be capable of operating the vehicle.

name: Plant
description: Plant-like or fungal creatures with regenerative abilities. Living plants, mushroom-based lifeforms. Regrowth: The creature regenerates 2 HP at the start of each of it’s turns

name: Powerful Inventions
description: Your character’s “Powers” come from their inventions. This means that they have a physical form, and take up physical space. Your character can only use their powers when they are “equipped”, and they take up space in their inventory. Your powers gain the “Technology” tag, and lose the “Magic” tag (if any).

name: Powerful Patron
description: You get your powers from another, more powerful being - whether an ancient spirit, a powerful energy-user, or extradimensional being. This Patron grants you access to a portion of their power, but they expect something from you in return. Your patron is not just powerful spiritually - they also have influence, resources, and connections that you can occasionally tap into to help you accomplish their goals.

name: Reptilian
description: Cold-blooded creatures, often tough and hardy. Dinosaurs, lizards, turtles, dragons. Tough Scales: Gain 1 Armor against attacks targeting physical defense (reduce damage by 1).

name: Shrinking
description: Body splits into multiple parts, controlled separately? Monster Library - keep a limited library of forms of defeated enemies you can switch into?

name: Slimefolk
description: You get your powers from another, more powerful being - whether an ancient spirit, a powerful energy-user, or extradimensional being. This Patron grants you access to a portion of their power, but they expect something from you in return. Your patron is not just powerful spiritually - they also have influence, resources, and connections that you can occasionally tap into to help you accomplish their goals.

name: Soul Reader
description: You may perform Investigation Actions using Attunement instead of Intellect. Once per round, when you act upon knowledge learned from an Investigation Action, you may increment your Power die.

name: Soul Vessel
description: Your power comes from another spirit or being that lives within you. This relationship is mutualistically symbiotic - you rely on the entity for power, and it relies on you for survival. However, that doesn’t necessarily make it friendly - the entities are often malevolent, and don’t necessarily take kindly to having to share their power.

name: Speedboat
description: Size: 6 x 3 squares (Scale 2) Strength: 5 Agility: 6 Speed: 10 HP: 30 Armor: 1 Tags: Aquatic Upgrade Slots: 3 Occupants: 5

name: Spiritual Bloodline
description: You come from a bloodline with an innate and powerful connection to the flow of spiritual energy. Thanks to your family's special sensory abilities you can sense the flow of spirit energy and see spirit phenomena that are normally invisible to others. You have heard legends of ancestors that were able to perform incredible feats of spiritual power, but you are still just beginning to scratch the surface of the potential that lies within you. However, along with these incredible gifts, you also carry the incredible burden of familial expectations and traditions.

name: Templates
description: A familiar’s “Template” is the basic type of creature that they are. This also grants a unique trait, and can modify their basic attack.

name: Temporary Gliding / Flight
description: “Natural Armor” - increased physical defenses “Natural Weapons” - spikes, claws, teeth Size changing? Enhanced senses? Examples: Tsuyu Asui (My Hero Academia), Titan-shifters (Attack on Titan), Diclonius (Elfen lied)

name: Thrill of Battle
description: Once per round, when you take damage from a melee attack, you may increment your Power Die.

name: Titan Shifter Path Initiate
description: Titan Form: (1 Action) Increment your power die. Your scale increases by 1. Your Titan Form can stack with your Metamorphic Transformations. This form lasts until the end of the combat, or until you choose to end it (no action required). Once you activate your Titan Form, you cannot do so again until you take a short rest. Turn Limbs into weapons?

name: Upgrading and Repairing Vehicles
description: When vehicles take damage, they can be restored to full HP by taking the “Repair” downtime action. If you have unlocked upgrades for your vehicle, you can also spend a downtime action working on the vehicle to install the upgrade, or swap with an existing upgrade.

name: Vehicle Actions
description: Run Over (1 Action) - Can only be performed if the vehicle moved at least 4 squares towards the target immediately before the action. The target must be in a location that the vehicle could move into based on it’s “facing” direction. Roll Agility (Driving) vs Physical Defense. Melee, 1 target. Damage: 5 + Hits + the Vehicle’s Strength. The vehicle and all occupants take ½ the damage dealt. On a success, if the vehicle is at least 1 size larger than the target, the target is pushed back 1 square (or 2 squares on a critical success).

name: Vehicle Movement
description: A vehicle’s movement is separate from its pilot’s - for example, a pilot may move on their turn, spend an action to enter the vehicle, then drive the vehicle up to its speed in the same turn. Unlike characters and monsters, vehicles have a “facing” direction. Vehicles can only move in the direction that they are facing, or a diagonal direction that includes the facing direction. They can move in reverse, but each square of reverse movement costs 2 squares. Vehicles can expend 1 square of movement to turn 90 degrees.

name: Vehicle Rules
description: Vehicles are a special type of equipment that enhances a user’s mobility, while also potentially providing offensive and defensive benefits. Vehicles require a pilot to operate, and may optionally have room for additional occupants.

name: Vehicle Stats
description: Vehicles have their own stats, including HP, Strength and Agility. Vehicles may also have their own skills - for example, most vehicles have a “Physical Defense” skill. While inside a vehicle, you will use the vehicles stats and skills instead of the stats and skills of your character. If a vehicle does not have a particular stat or skill (such as intellect) continue to use your character’s stat instead.

name: Vehicle Templates
description: A Vehicle template is the starting point for creating a custom vehicle. It determines the initial fundamental stats of the vehicle, including size, speed, and HP. Templates have a “Rank” - a character can only operate a vehicle if their “Driving” skill rank is at least the rank of the vehicle.

name: Vehicles in Combat
description: Attacks against a vehicle may choose to target *either* the vehicle itself or the Pilot (as long as the vehicle does not grant the pilot full cover. When a vehicle drops to 0 hit points, it becomes inoperable. Characters may still enter and exit the vehicle normally, but it cannot move or perform any actions.

name: Wall Crawler
description: You gain the ability to cling to vertical surfaces, allowing you to climb at full speed. You can climb even smooth surfaces and ceilings, as long as they are not wet or slippery.

name: Water
description: Water is the element of healing and disruption.

name: Wind
description: Wind is the element of mobility. Most wind abilities have to do with movement - either by enhancing your own movement, or using wind to redirect other creatures, objects, etc. See the “Forced Movement” section for more information.

name: Absorb Elements
description: Absorb Elements: (1 Reaction) Reaction Trigger: You are damaged by an effect with an elemental tag Reduce the damage by an amount based on your metamorphosis skill rank and the amount of energy spent. Your next attack gains the trait of the element you absorbed with this technique, and deals additional damage equal to the amount of damage reduced. Rank 1:  Damage Reduction: 4, +1 per energy Rank 2:  Damage Reduction: 6, +1 per energy Rank 3:  Damage Reduction: 8, +1 per energy Rank 4:  Damage Reduction: 10, +1 per energy Rank 5:  Damage Reduction: 12, +2 per energy Rank 6:  Damage Reduction: 14, +2 per energy

name: Bestial Claw Slash
description: Tags: Sharp Bestial Claw Slash: (1 Action): Primary (Metamorphosis) vs Physical Defense. 1 Target, Melee Reach 2 You transform your hands into sharp claws, which you use to slash at your opponent. This attack does damage based on your Metamorphosis skill rank and the amount of energy spent. Rank 1:  Damage =  6 + Hits, +1 damage per energy Rank 2:  Damage =  9 + Hits, +1 damage per energy Rank 3:  Damage =  12 + Hits, +2 damage per energy Rank 4:  Damage =  15 + Hits, +2 damage per energy Rank 5:  Damage =  18 + Hits, +3 damage per energy Rank 6:  Damage =  24 + Hits, +3 damage per energy

name: Binding Vines
description: Binding Vines: (1 Action + 3 Energy (Sustained)): 1 Target, Melee Reach 5 Damage: 4 + Hits. On Success: The target is grappled. This grapple does not use up one of your hands. A target grappled this way takes 4 damage at the beginning of each of their turns. On Critical Success: The target is also stunned 1 until the end of their next turn.

name: Doppelganger
description: Doppelganger: (1 Action + 3 Energy) You take on the appearance of a specific individual you have seen. If someone is familiar with that person, make Primary (Metamorphosis) vs Mental Defense roll to fool them.

name: Elemental Chaos Strike
description: Elemental Chaos Strike: (1 Action + 3 Energy): Primary (Metamorphosis) vs Physical Defense, 1 Target, Melee You transform your fist into an elemental form and use it to strike your enemies. Roll a d8 to determine the chosen element. Your attack has that tag, and the attack modifiers of the chosen element. Damage: 8 + Hits

name: Rubber Punch
description: Rubber Punch: (1 Action): Primary (Metamorphosis) vs Physical Defense. 1 Target, Melee Reach 2 You transform a limb into a stretchy, rubbery material, allowing you to punch or kick from a further distance. This attack does damage based on your Metamorphosis skill rank. For each energy you spend on this attack, increase the Reach by 1. Rank 1:  Damage =  4 + Hits, Rank 2:  Damage =  7 + Hits Rank 3:  Damage =  8 + Hits Rank 4:  Damage =  11 + Hits Rank 5:  Damage =  12 + Hits Rank 6:  Damage =  18 + Hit

name: Savage Bite
description: Savage Bite: (1 Action + 3 Energy): Primary (Metamorphosis) vs Physical Defense, 1 Target, Melee You bite your target with powerful, beastlike jaws. Damage: 9 + Hits On Success: The target is Bleeding 2 On Critical Success: The target is Bleeding 4

name: Swiss Army Hands
description: Swiss Army Hands: (1 Action + 3 Energy) Your hands transform into a mundane scale -2 object, such as a magnifying glass or a lockpick. This object can have simple mechanical components. While transformed in this way, if the object would be beneficial to a skill check, you gain a +1D equipment bonus to that check.

name: Monster Evolution or Collection
description: Choose one of the following: Monster Evolution - One of your Monster Companions gains a new evolution. Choose one of your Monster Companions. If the rank of that companion is lower than your Monster Taming skill, increase its Rank by 1. Otherwise, if that creature does not have a Stage 2 evolution, it gains a Stage 2 evolution and one additional Familiar trait. Stage 2 Evolution (1 Action + 3 Energy). Your Monster Companion transforms into a new, more powerful form. It is treated as 1 Rank higher, and gains 1 Familiar trait of its new Rank or lower. If the creature already has a Stage 2 transformation, it gains a Stage 3 transformation and an additional Familiar trait. Stage 3 Evolution (1 Action + 5 Energy). Your Monster Companion transforms into a new, more powerful form. It is treated as 2 Ranks higher than its base rank, and gains 1 Familiar trait of its new Rank or lower. Monster Collection - You gain a new Monster Companion. Its rank is 1 less than your Monster Taming skill. You make this choice again at levels 4, 6, 8, and 10.

name: Advanced Monster Taming
description: Your training in the “Monster Taming” skill increases to Rank 2 (Advanced).

name: Illusion School
description: You can generate minor visual illusions. As an action, you can expend 1 energy to create a simple, immobile visual illusion that does not exceed 5 feet in any dimension. You can only have one such illusion active at a time. In addition, you gain +2 to detect or resist visual, auditory, and mental illusions.

name: Shadow School
description: Improves ability to hide in shadows, maybe teleport from shadow to shadow

name: Summoning School
description: You gain a Rank 1 Familiar (See Familiar Subsystem).

name: Disable spiritual energy (e.g. pressure points)
description: 5 point palm exploding heart

name: Flight
description: Various beams, spirit bombs, etc. “Ultra Instict” - instinctively avoid attacks

name: Incredible feats of strength / destruction
description: Resistance to changes in gravity, etc. Temporarily boosting strength at a cost (Chakra gates, Kaio-ken) Various martial arts techniques - whirlwind kick, rising kick, etc.

name: Instant teleportation
description: Form changes (e.g. super saiyan) - difficult to control / cause rage?

name: Qi Blaster Initiate
description: This path grants additional control over the spiritual energy that courses through your body. Reduce the energy cost of Martial Arts techniques with the “Spirit” tag by 1. When you perform the “Spirit Blast” technique, you can spend additional energy to modify the range and shape of the attack. 3 energy - Instead of a single target, the attack deals damage to creatures in a 3 square cone or a 6 square line. Note: Energy spent in this way does not increase the damage of the attack

name: Soulrager Initiate
description: The power inside of you is more than you can control, so most of the time it stays locked down. However, in moments of intense danger the power can come bursting out. As an action you can choose to gain 1 strain and transform into your Soulrager form. When you activate your Soulrager Transformation, increment your Power Die by 1. You gain armor equal to your Martial Arts rank, and your unarmed strikes also deal increased damage equal to this amount. At the beginning of each of your turns, you gain 1 strain while in this form. Whenever you exit this form, or become overstrained while in this form, you take damage equal to your current strain. Once you activate this form, it cannot be activated again until you take a short rest.

name: Spirit Manipulator Initiate
description: This Path can not only manipulate the Spirit Energy in themselves, but also in others. Once per round, when you roll a success on a Martial Arts attack against a marked enemy, you may reduce that enemy’s Energy by 1, and increment your Power Die. As an action, you may also spend energy to restore hit points to yourself or one adjacent ally. You restore HP equal to 2 * the amount of energy spent.

name: Split Focus
description: You are experienced at fighting multiple opponents at once. You may mark up to 2 enemies simultaneously, and do not take a -1D penalty for attacking enemies that are not marked. When you perform a Martial Arts technique that allows more than one strike, you may perform those strikes against different targets and may move between strikes.

name: Stance Adept
description: Gain an additional Rank 1 Stance. When you roll initiative, you may immediately activate a stance (no action required).

name: What Doesn’t Kill You
description: Once per combat, when your health would drop to 0, instead of becoming defeated you regain HP equal to 2 * Strength, and increment your Power Die.

name: Commander Path Initiate
description: This path focuses on support and leadership.You gain the following benefits: Shared Heart: When your Heart Stealer feature activates, instead of restoring HP to yourself you can choose to restore HP to one ally you can see that you share a bond with. Tactical Order: You gain a number of “Commands” equal to your Heart attribute. When an ally you can see makes a attack roll, you may choose to spend one “Command” to add +1D to that ally’s roll (after seeing the result of their roll, but before determining the outcome). You may also spend 1 action and 1 command to grant 1 additional action to an ally you can see.

name: Energy Reservoir
description: Your Soulbound weapon serves as a reserve of energy, and can store an amount equal to your Attunement. As an action you can retrieve this energy from your weapon, increasing your own pool of available energy. The weapon’s reserves recharge when you take a short rest.

name: Ghostwalker Path Initiate
description: You are able make your body semi-incorporeal, allowing you to (and your weapon) to temporarily phase through obstacles. When you move, you can move through objects and enemies (but cannot end your turn in the same space as another creature or object). You know the locations of creatures behind full cover, and they are only obscured (but not concealed) from you. When you make an attack, you may spend 3 energy to ignore cover for that attack, as your weapon phases through the obstacle.

name: Soul Stealer
description: Once per round when you trigger Heart Stealer, instead of healing yourself you may choose to increment your Power die instead. If you defeat a creature whose threat level is equal to or higher than your level, you may instead choose to regain 1 action point. Possible Feats / Class Features (Uncategorized)

name: Soulbound Pair
description: Prerequisite: One-handed soulbound weapon You gain a second one-handed soulbound weapon. Both weapons are treated as a single weapon - they can both be summoned as part of the same action, and any weapon enhancements on your soulbound weapon apply to both (as long as they meet the prerequisites).

name: Warden Soul Path Initiate
description: Your soulbound weapon is able to manifest as a visible, but incorporeal, spirit. It is treated as a Rank 1 familiar with the “Spirit” template. You also gain the following benefits: Soulguard Defender: Your weapon spirit helps defend you against spiritual attacks. You gain armor 1 vs Spiritual Defense Rolls. Your Weapons with the “Defensive” tag can parry attacks that target Spiritual Defense, as well as Physical Defense.

name: Weaponsmith
description: Choose an additional Level 1 weapon enhancement, and apply it to one of your weapons. This enhancement does not count towards that weapon’s enhancement slots. When you take a short rest, you can change this enhancement (either replacing it with a different enhancement, or moving it to a new weapon).

name: Advanced Weapon Training
description: You can choose to either upgrade your existing Soulbound Weapon to a Rank 2 version of the same base, or choose a new Rank 2 weapon base. You gain one additional enhancement for your Soulbound Weapon (which can be up to Rank 2), and you can also swap one of your existing enhancements with a new one of Rank 2 or lower.

name: Weapon Master Feat
description: Learn a single Weapon Master class feat, or a general feat. (Need level 4+ feats)

name: Master Weapon Training
description: Your training in the Melee Weapons and Targeting skills increases to Rank 3 (Master). You can choose to either upgrade your existing Soulbound Weapon to a Rank 3 version of the same base, or choose a new Rank 3 weapon base. You gain one additional enhancement for your Soulbound Weapon (which can be up to Rank 3), and you can also swap one of your existing enhancements with a new one of Rank 3 or lower.

name: Spirit Beast Transformation
description: Your weapon manifests as a spirit creature - such as a dragon, tiger, phoenix, etc. The movements of your weapon direct the movements of the creature.

name: Weapon Transformation
description: Choose one of the following Stage 1 weapon transformations. You can spend 1 Action + 3 Energy to transform your weapon into the new form. The weapon still functions as a weapon - it retains all of its enhancements, techniques, etc. While in the new form, your Skill rank for the appropriate Weapon Skill (Melee Weapons or Targeting) is treated as 1 Rank higher.

name: Colossus Transformation
description: You summon an enormous spiritual construct around you. It mimics your movements, and wields an enlarged version of your weapon. Sustained technique. Increases attack range and damage, also increases defenses? Feats

name: Ultimate Weapon Transformation (Level 11)
description: Choose one of the following Stage 2 weapon transformations. When your weapon is in a Stage 1 transformation, you can spend 1 Action + 5 Energy to transform your weapon into Stage 2. The weapon still functions as a weapon - it retains all of its enhancements, techniques, etc. While in the new form, your Skill rank for the appropriate Weapon Skill (Melee Weapons or Targeting) is treated as 2 Ranks higher than your normal skill rank (e.g. 1 Rank higher than your Stage 1 transformation).
